definition:
Let $U \subset \mathbb{C}$ be a domain and let
$f: U \longrightarrow \mathbb{C}$ be a function represented by a Laurent
series $$f(z) := \sum_{k=-\infty}^\infty c_k (z-a)^k$$ centered about
$a$. The coefficient $c_{-1}$ of the above Laurent series is called the
*residue* of $f$ at $a$, and denoted $\operatorname{Res}(f;a)$.
